reviews.title: Large rooms, excellent AC, and great value
reviews.text: I have stayed in two different rooms. Both were very clean inside. The windows and door frames were "cluttered" with spider webs on the outside which, while unsightly, might be a good thing, as there were hundreds of gnats trapped in the webs (the outdoor security lights attract the bugs).

reviews.title: Non-Responsive and RUDE
reviews.text: The AC was excellent and quiet. The rooms were very generous in size and had a fridge. The baths in both rooms were a tad dimmer than I prefer, but very clean. If you need a room in or near Soap Lake, this works very well! I also recommend Don's Restaurant across the street. Try the Don's Club Steak.

This place has SERIOUS issues. I arrived at 2:30 PM. Rooms weren’t cleaned yet. Desk stated they’d be ready by 4:00. I booked a room and waited until 5:00 PM to return. They hadn’t even started to clean the room yet. Front desk was rude upon my requesting a refund. I had to insist on a receipt for crediting back my Visa card. No apologies were offered whatsoever for wasting my afternoon.
reviews.title: Nice Lodge but issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally posted a review a month ago and it seems to be missing so we're re-posting it. We enjoyed the location next to the beach and the lodge was ok but we did have some issues. For example, the room was very spacious but old fashioned and a little musty with mold in the shower. There was a group of several families in the room across from ours who sat on their balcony most of the evening and were very noisy singing and drinking wine. Although that isn't the resort's fault, the noise came right through the uninsulated wood walls and the office closes at 5:00 pm so there wasn't anyone to report it to to try to change rooms. Also, we were in an adjoining unit and every time someone walked in the room next to us, our room seemed to vibrate. When we called to make the reservation, we upgraded rooms as we were told ours would have a King bed. When we arrived, it was only a queen. Other than these issues, we enjoyed ours tay.
reviews.title: Unbeatable service

reviews.text: I was staying with a friend who suggested a trip to Soap Lake as we could enjoy some sunny and warm weather instead of the overcast skies and incessant rain that we had been NOT been enjoying in Seattle. At the same time we could "take" the waters of the lake for medicinal purposes. She had been there previously and was adamant that the ONLY place to stay was at the Notaras Lodge.
reviews.title: Perfection!
